title: Ticket #5084: condor_q should be able to show the transfer queue
description:
Similar to the way condor_q -io shows standard universe IO stats, condor_q -transfer should show jobs transferring data, and jobs waiting in the transfer queue. The following attributes are of interest 

    TransferringInput
    TransferrringOutput
    TransferQueued
    BytesRecvd
    BytesSent
remarks:
2015-Jun-10 15:30:32 by johnkn:
The approach will be to change condor_q -io to that it shows vanilla jobs that are transferring or queueed for transfer as well as standard universe jobs.

This will involve some rearrangement of the standard universe output columns. The output will look something like this: 

-- Schedd: submit-3.chtc.wisc.edu : <128.104.100.44:23208?... : submit-3.chtc.wisc.edu
 ID      OWNER          RUNS ST  INPUT    OUTPUT   RATE      MISC
 576.0   jenga            32 R    1.6 MB   1.6 MB  23.0 B /s seeks=0, buf=524288,32768
 576.1   jenga            52 R    1.6 MB   1.6 MB  24.0 B /s seeks=0, buf=524288,32768
 576.2   jenga            32 I    1.6 MB   1.6 MB  23.0 B /s seeks=0, buf=524288,32768
1063.0   bizarro          0 <     .        .        .       transfer=in
1066.0   bizarro          0 q>  72.6 MB    .      72.6 MB/s transfer=out,queued
1098.0   bizarro          0 <     .        .        .       transfer=in
1135.0   bizarro          0 <     .        .        .       transfer=in
1524.0   bizarro          0 <q    .        .        .       transfer=in,queued
1525.0   bizarro          0 <q    .        .        .       transfer=in,queued

9 jobs; 0 completed, 0 removed, 7 idle, 2 running, 0 held, 0 suspended
